snippet: One of the world’s largest furniture manufacturers faces $1.7 million in penalties to settle charges that unsafe conditions at a Wisconsin plant led to more than 1,000 injuries.
abstract: Occupational Safety and Health Administration charges furniture maker Ashley Furniture with unsafe conditions at its plant in Arcadia, Wis, that caused more than 1,000 injuries; company faces $1.7 million in fines.
lead_paragraph: One of the world’s largest furniture manufacturers faces $1.7 million in penalties to settle charges that unsafe conditions at a Wisconsin plant led to more than 1,000 injuries.

headline.main: OSHA Cites Ashley Furniture Over Dozens of Safety Violations
headline.print_headline: OSHA Cites Ashley Furniture Over Dozens of Safety Violations
